conclusion: Analyze the forces involved to determine the pressure exerted by sphere D on spheres A, B, and C.
Each sphere has a mass m, so the gravitational force F_g acting on each sphere is F_g = mg.
The upper sphere D exerts a downward force due to gravity.
The upper sphere D is in equilibrium, so the vertical forces must balance.
The gravitational force mg of sphere D is counteracted by the upward normal forces N from the lower spheres A, B, and C.
Due to symmetry, the force exerted by the upper sphere D is distributed equally among the three lower spheres A, B, and C.
Each of the lower spheres supports an equal portion of the weight of sphere D.
The total gravitational force of sphere D is mg.
This force is distributed equally among the three lower spheres, so each lower sphere supports mg/3.
The pressure exerted by sphere D on each lower sphere is given by the force per unit area.
The pressure exerted on each of the three lower spheres A, B, and C is mg/3.
